NEW YORK Pres. Lyndon
Johnson may become the most eff
fective civil rights advocate ever
to occupy the White House. a lead
ing Negro author declared.


In the current issue Of Look
Magazine, Louis E. Lomax said
Johns on 8 emergence as a civil
rights leader is due to "a con-
fluence Of the times and his
own personal commitment to ra-
cial Justice"


Lyndon Baines Johnson"
said Lomax, els this nation grow
ing up. He. is the white South
erner shaking off the shackles of
his beginnings: he is the Negro
learning that he who would be
loved must himself not hate: he
is the white Northern liberal
realizing that prejudice. whether
1t be racial or sectional, is
wrong"


Lomax also credited the PreSi-
dent wife. Ladybird. for broad
ening and giving "honest sub
stance" to Johnson S views on
racial matters.


Because Of his Southern back
ground and earlier uncertain rec
ord on civil rights, however,
Johns n's succession to the
Presidency had caused deep
anguish and apprehension In the
Negro community" Lonax said

tation system for one Of the

vanced furfural solvent extrac-
ton plants. now under construc-
ton.

LBJ SLATED
FOR GREATNESS
